title: Print Hello World
description: Write a program that prints 'Hello, World!' to the console.
solution: public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("Hello, World!"); } }

title: Print Your Name
description: Write a program that prints your name to the console.
hints: Replace the string with your actual name
solution: public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { System.out.println("John Doe"); } }

title: Sum of Two Numbers
description: Write a program that takes two integers as input and prints their sum.
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); int a = sc.nextInt(); int b = sc.nextInt(); System.out.println(a + b); } }

title: Multiply Two Numbers
description: Write a program that takes two integers as input and prints their product.
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); int a = sc.nextInt(); int b = sc.nextInt(); System.out.println(a * b); } }

title: Check Even or Odd
description: Write a program that checks whether a number is even or odd.
hints: If a number is divisible by 2, it's even
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); int n = sc.nextInt(); if (n % 2 == 0) { System.out.println("Even"); } else { System.out.println("Odd"); } } }

title: Find the Larger Number
description: Write a program that takes two numbers and prints the larger one.
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); int a = sc.nextInt(); int b = sc.nextInt(); System.out.println(a > b ? a : b); } }

title: Check Positive, Negative, or Zero
description: Write a program that checks if a number is positive, negative, or zero.
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); int n = sc.nextInt(); if (n > 0) { System.out.println("Positive"); } else if (n < 0) { System.out.println("Negative"); } else { System.out.println("Zero"); } } }

title: Simple Grade Calculator
description: Write a program that takes a student's score and prints their grade (A, B, C, D, or F).
hints: Compare the score with grade thresholds
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); int score = sc.nextInt(); if (score >= 90) { System.out.println("A"); } else if (score >= 80) { System.out.println("B"); } else if (score >= 70) { System.out.println("C"); } else if (score >= 60) { System.out.println("D"); } else { System.out.println("F"); } } }

title: Leap Year Checker
description: Write a program that checks if a given year is a leap year.
hints: A leap year is divisible by 4 but not 100 unless also divisible by 400
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); int year = sc.nextInt(); if ((year % 4 == 0 && year % 100 != 0) || (year % 400 == 0)) { System.out.println("Leap Year"); } else { System.out.println("Not a Leap Year"); } } }

title: Simple Calculator
description: Write a program that performs addition, subtraction, multiplication, or division based on user input.
hints: Use switch-case to handle different operations
Take two numbers and an operator as input
solution: import java.util.Scanner; public class Main { public static void main(String[] args) { Scanner sc = new Scanner(System.in); int a = sc.nextInt(); int b = sc.nextInt(); char op = sc.next().charAt(0); switch(op) { case '+': System.out.println(a + b); break; case '-': System.out.println(a - b); break; case '*': System.out.println(a * b); break; case '/': System.out.println(a / b); break; default: System.out.println("Invalid operator"); } } }
